com.nutiteq.datasources.raster

Class MBTilesRasterDataSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nutiteq.rasterdatasources.AbstractRasterDataSource
      • com.nutiteq.datasources.raster.MBTilesRasterDataSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UTFGridDataSource, com.nutiteq.rasterdatasources.RasterDataSource

    public class MBTilesRasterDataSource
extends com.nutiteq.rasterdatasources.AbstractRasterDataSource
implements UTFGridDataSource
    A raster data source class for reading map tiles from local Sqlite database. The database must contain table tiles with the following fields:

    zoom_level (zoom level of the tile), tile_column, tile_row, tile_data (compressed tile bitmap)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.nutiteq.rasterdatasources.RasterDataSource

    • Constructor Detail

      • MBTilesRasterDataSource

        public MBTilesRasterDataSource(com.nutiteq.projections.Projection projection,
                       int minZoom,
                       int maxZoom,
                       String path,
                       boolean tmsY,
                       android.content.Context ctx)
                        throws IOException
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        projection - projection for the data source (practically always EPSG3857)
        minZoom - minimum zoom supported by the data source.
        maxZoom - maximum zoom supported by the data source.
        path - path to the local Sqlite database file. SQLiteException will be thrown if the database does not exist or can not be opened in read-only mode.
        tmsY - flag describing if tiles are vertically flipped or not
        ctx - Android application context.
        Throws:
        IOException - exception if file not exists

    • Method Detail

      • reopen

        public void reopen(String path,
          boolean tmsY,
          android.content.Context ctx)
            throws IOException
        Reopen database file
        Parameters:
        path - path to the local Sqlite database file. SQLiteException will be thrown if the database does not exist or can not be opened in read-only mode.
        tmsY - flag describing if tiles are vertically flipped or not
        ctx - Android application context.
        Throws:
        IOException - exception if file not exists

      • close

        public void close()
        Close database file. After calling this, new tiles will not be read from the database.

      • getDatabase

        public MBTilesDbHelper getDatabase()
        Get database helper instance.
        Returns:
        database helper instance if database is open, or null if closed.
